title: This game is unjust
body:
i played a rank game in my main. went 11/3 and was in the verge of winning. Instead of ending the game, Jhin decided to BM and cost us the game. I got ban cuz i flamed him after the game. It makes no sense. He fuking cost us the game. how am i getting ban for that. that fuker sohuld be perma ban. 

explain riot? why all these noobs in my game? y ban me? it was post game chat and it wasnt going to affect his play style during the game. 

this is y people are so toxic. u pinish the wrong people. what a shame.

replies.body:
Seriously?
Riot goes beyond and out of their way by telling you NOT TO FLAME. Regardless of any situation. Period.
Then you go flame anyway and you say this game is unjust when justice was just served? 

Right... It's only unjust because you got punished for your own actions. 
They punished the right people from what I see. Serves you right.

> [{quoted}](name=Zombie Gerbil,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=HRpWoxbl,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2018-08-24T01:57:32.800+0000)
>
> Seriously?
> Riot goes beyond and out of their way by telling you NOT TO FLAME. Regardless of any situation. Period.
> Then you go flame anyway and you say this game is unjust when justice was just served? 
> 
> Right... It's only unjust because you got punished for your own actions. 
> They punished the right people from what I see. Serves you right.

It's not justice, it's enforcing a rule. A rule can be inappropriate, enforcing method can be inappropriate. Bans for chat are exactly that - inappropriate. Like execution for stealing a carrot.

> [{quoted}](name=Mc Truck,realm=EUW,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=HRpWoxbl,comment-id=00050000,timestamp=2018-08-24T06:09:29.536+0000)
>
> It's not justice, it's enforcing a rule. A rule can be inappropriate, enforcing method can be inappropriate. Bans for chat are exactly that - inappropriate. Like execution for stealing a carrot.

I think Life without Parole would be a more apt metaphor here. If you can't be trusted not to steal when the carrots are there then how can you be trusted not to steal when the carrots are removed? Same thing with chat basically, where how can you be trusted to behave properly without chat when you couldn't be trusted to do so with chat? Riot tried perma-mutes in the past and they didn't work since most people simply resorted to gameplay altering means of harassing other players when they couldn't do so in chat. From [Riot Tantram:](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/wsObUaFj-if-tyler1?comment=00010001000000000000) 

> It really breaks down into two categories.
> 
> 1.) Helping players reform
> 2.) Shielding others from the behavior, at a cost.
> 
> We used to issue chat restrictions that essentially scaled indefinitely. 
> 
> We were able to determine that after a certain point the penalty no longer helped with reform. The 10-game and 25-game counts for chat restrictions are based on data that they were both light enough, and felt strict enough to encourage people to understand their behavior is unacceptable in game and change it.
> 
> We also saw that the players in this 'large restriction' category defaulted to gameplay altering means of harassing their team. It caused an increase in feeding and trolling.
> 
> The sample size of this population and time frame is huge. Essentially the time spanning from the introduction of chat restrictions to the introduction of IFS.
> 
> So my question for you is, would you rather have more feeders and less negative chat?

If someone isn't gonna behave properly despite being given multiple chances to do so then why shouldn't they be removed from the game? The line has to be drawn somewhere.

how's it unjust? you flamed, got banned.

Sounds normal, hold your temper.


and you got perma'd cause you most likely flame alot.

I'm actually not sure if this is satirical or not - if it is, well played. Assuming this is serious though, the reason you were banned is because you likely have a record of flaming other players. No one, and I mean no one, get's banned because of one offense. Everyone get's upset sometimes, and RIot understands this, thus for you to receive a punishment of any kind you would have had to shown a history of this behavior. Additionally addressing the capability of players around you, understand that you are in the same MMR bracket as them, meaning they are approximately as good as you are. Everyone has off games, but those games only get worse when a teammate flames them. I understand being upset, I get upset too, but honestly just play a few games in which you don't type and you mute everyone. It allows you to focus on yourself and possibly even carry your "noob" teammates.
You had a lead **but weren't good enough to end the game and win,** so you BMd a team mate and got banned. The only way this leads to a ban is if you do it often. Cya.

Games aren't just about winning mate. They're about having fun. You cannot and should not attempt to make another person feel miserable while playing the game. Even if they deserve it.

It's not our place to punish teammates who deserve to be punished. Leave that to Riot. When another player does something like that Jhin did, report them after the game and/or submit a support ticket about their behavior. Don't flame them though, because it won't accomplish anything except to get you punished like it did here.
Chat logs Chat logs Chat logs!

> [{quoted}](name=TH3 l AND ONLY,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=HRpWoxbl,comment-id=,timestamp=2018-08-24T00:34:31.885+0000)
>
> i played a rank game in my main. went 11/3 and was in the verge of winning. Instead of ending the game, Jhin decided to BM and cost us the game. **I got ban cuz i flamed him after the game**. It makes no sense. He fuking cost us the game. how am i getting ban for that. **that fuker sohuld be perma ban**. 

You have the damn answer just below your eyes, mate.
you flame you banned its that simple

Pre- and Post-game chat have always been taken into consideration when it comes to issuing a punishment to someone, and cases like this are exactly why. You thought that because it wasn't in-game you could behave however you wanted without fear of being punished. As you've found out you can't, as it's still poor behavior regardless of where it's done at. Assuming you're telling the truth about Jhin what he did was wrong sure, but that still doesn't give you the right to flame him over it. You can be frustrated and annoyed sure, and in that situation why wouldn't you be? But just because it's not in-game doesn't mean that poor behavior is suddenly excusable. Get used to it.

The game is unjust, and you will just have to deal with it. it is a video game, not a court where law is on your side. if you feel like flaming someone, just don't do it. Yell IRL if you have to, but follow the rules and report.

yeah except this is completely justified

all the system haters love to think that a one off phrase gets them banned and its a conspiracy and riot is out to get them

the system punishes **CONSISTENT NEGATIVE BEHAVIOR** (with the exception of zero-tolerance phrases)
